foothold noun [C]
(STRONG POSITION)
a strong first position from which further progress can be made: gain a foothold We are still trying to gain a foothold in the Japanese market.get a foothold Having survived the attack, the team had hopes of getting a foothold in the game.

foothold noun [C]
(SAFE PLACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a place where you can safely put your feet, esp. when climbing: She searched desperately for a foothold in the steep rock.
foothold noun [C]
(SITUATION)
a situation in which someone has obtained the power or influence needed to get what is wanted: In buying their business, the company gains a major foothold in a market it considers critical to the future of the industry.
Add to word list
Add to word list
a strong first position in a market, industry, etc. from which further progress can be made: give sth a foothold (in sth) The merger gives the company a stronger presence in Asia and a foothold in the US.establish/gain/get a foothold (in sth) Our plan is to gain a foothold in the fastest-growing aerospace industry in the world.
